results.title: Use your head
results.brief_description: In this video, Tony Buzan explains how to acquire skills needed in any successful business - effective learning, creative thinking and problem solving. He introduces the key concept of mind mapping and explains how reading power and memory can be improved.

results.title: Urinary incontinence: a personal disaster (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Royal Society of Medicine Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Discusses the causes of incontinence and methods of treatment. Endeavours to isolate specific causes and direct the treatment to that cause.
Suitable for medical students and staff.

results.title: Urbanissimo
results.brief_description: This film is a colourful statement on the destruction of nature, city planning, aimless construction and rebuilding, pollution and the revamping of natural life styles that comes with a mechanised society. Modern jazz music and subtle sound effects are used in this entertaining film. This film was included as the finale in the main pavilion of Expo ‘67 in Canada and later screened at the 43rd San Francisco International Film Festival, April 20-May 4, 2000.

results.title: Urban land use (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Radcliffe, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Dr.J.Blunden discusses various attempts to analyse and quantify the spatial structure of urban zones, using Chicago as a primary illustration. In particular he considers E.W. Burgess and his concentric zone theory, and Homer Hoyts sectoral model, and both are integrated into a composite model.

results.title: Urban impact on weather and climate
results.brief_description: As man changes the surface of the earth through ever increasing urbanization there are corresponding changes in the weather and climate he must endure. Uses experimental models to show effects on rainfall, temperature, normal wind circulation and surface temperature, and the effects of pollutants. No other credits available.

results.title: Urban alternatives
results.creator_credit: Hans Halberstadt and Arthur Barr Productions
results.brief_description: In an attempt to counter the argument that the city is dead, this film surveys some of the alternatives, constructed by designers and architects working as urban environmentalists.

results.title: Up pill, down pill
results.creator_credit: J. Gary Mitchell and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: An open-ended dramatisation that explores different lifestyles - lifestyles through which the central figures try to adjust to disappointments and frustrations. For two young men pills offer an escape from life, in contrast Charlie, an old man who objects to being retired, pours his energies into a derelict boat. Designed to stimulate discussion of the type of decisions young people must make.
